headline: Sandisk surges as robust AI demand powers blowout forecast
summary: Sandisk shares rallied on Friday, after the data storage firm projected third-quarter profit and revenue well above analysts' estimates and ​extended a major supply deal, powered by a surge in AI-driven demand ‌for data storage.  The company forecast fiscal third-quarter revenue to be between $4.4 billion and $4.8 billion, and adjusted profit in the range of $12-$14 per share.  The midpoints of both were above the estimated $2.77 billion ⁠and $4.37 per share, respectively, according ‌to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: Micron Stock Keeps Climbing—And a Top Executive May Have Sold Too Soon
summary: Shares of  Micron Technology  have surged since the start of the year, and one top executive appears to be taking profits—but his returns could have been even bigger.  A securities filing on Monday shows that Manish Bhatia, Micron’s executive vice president of global operations, sold a total of 26,623 shares through six separate transactions on Jan. 22.  The transactions were conducted at prices ranging from $388.41 to $395.905 a share, amounting to more than $10.4 million worth of company stock.

headline: Western Digital Earnings And Innovation Day Test AI Storage Hopes
summary: Western Digital (NasdaqGS:WDC) is preparing to report its fiscal Q2 2026 earnings, with results expected to reflect current demand trends in AI driven data storage. The company is also planning an Innovation Day around the same period to showcase new products and operational updates tied to the AI data economy. These events follow strong sector interest after peer Seagate's recent earnings and growing attention on data center related storage demand. Western Digital's share price sits at...
